item.content:encoded:
Is New Year Supposed To Be Capitalized 2024. For your question Do You Capitalize Happy New Year?, the answer is yes. Nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs all need to be capitalized in titles as well. If a general time period uses a proper noun, capitalize only the proper noun. The short answer is that New Year (and Happy New Year) are capitalized. It is also a conundrum for anyone who sends out holiday cards. For starters, the first word in a title is always capitalized. Another thing is, the words eve and day following the holiday name should also be capitalized. The basic rule for the capitalization of periods and events is to capitalize specific names but not general terms.

Happy New Year should be capitalized while using it for greeting someone in cards. Capitalize proper nouns—and adjectives derived from proper nouns.
